identificationModule.briefTitle: Association of Renal-tubular Acidosis in Children With Cow Milk Protein Allergy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Association of Renal-tubular Acidosis in Children With Cow Milk Protein Allergy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Our study aims to detect renal manifestations of children proved to be with cow milk protein allergy special focusing on tubular dysfunction.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is a cross-sectional study that will be conducted over 6 months at the pediatric department, Sohag University Hospital, Sohag, Egypt.

Children proved to be with cow milk protein allergy by oral challenge test after stabilization and prevention of cow protein with Age group from 3 months up to 3 years attending outpatient clinic at Sohag University Hospital will be included in the study.

The study participants will be subjected to full history taking and thorough clinical examination at the pediatric outpatient clinic and their medical files will be reviewed.

interventions.name: investigations
interventions.description: laboratory assesment Kidney function test, Urine analysis, Arterial blood gases ,Electrolytes (Na,K,Cl,Ca,phosphorus) and Calcium/creatinine ratio , Total serum IgE Radiological assessment Abdominal ultrasonography

primaryOutcomes.measure: investigate association of Renal tubular acidosis in cow milk protein allergy patients
primaryOutcomes.description: Our study aims to detect renal manifestations of children proved to be with cow milk protein allergy special focusing on tubular dysfunction

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Children proved to be with cow milk protein allergy by oral challenge test after stabilization and prevention of cow protein with Age group from 3 months up to 3 years attending outpatient clinic at Sohag University Hospital will be included in the study

Exclusion Criteria:

\-
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Children proved to be with cow milk protein allergy by oral challenge test after stabilization and prevention of cow protein with Age group from 3 months up to 3 years
